title: Find Low-Competition Keywords for Amazon KDP

tactics.name: Amazon Search Bar
tactics.description: Use Amazon's auto-suggestions to find real keywords buyers are searching for.
steps: Go to Amazon.com and type a keyword related to your book idea
Check search result counts for competitiveness
Analyze top page one books for quality signals
caveats: May not account for keyword volume accurately
source_quotes: Amazon will automatically suggest phrases. These are real keywords real buyers are searching for.

tactics.name: First Page Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate competition quality by analyzing top-ranking books.
steps: Click first five books on page one
Assess cover quality and title/description quality
source_quotes: If the top books look weak, that's a green light. Competition is not just about numbers, it's about quality.

heuristics.name: Review Threshold Boost
heuristics.condition: If review count is below 200, prioritize keyword
source_quotes: Avoid single word keywords like journal, copying bestsellers without research.

claims.statement: Low competition keywords allow beginners to avoid competing with big brands
source_quotes: This is where beginners win. You don't want to compete with 10,000 books.

niche_patterns.description: Target specific niches with clear demand and weak competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines identity (target audience), problem (specific need), and constraint (narrow search)
source_quotes: Avoid choosing keywords based on excitement, not data. Amazon KDP is a business, not gambling.
